intro: Pimpinella curvata, commonly known as the curly cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it is often found in disturbed soils. Pimpinella curvata is a herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
